about-description:
My name is Daniele Scheibler, I am a UX/UI Designer with a degree in Biological Sciences and a background in graphic design, video editing and motion design.
Born in Rio Grande do Sul, I began my academic journey in science, but found my true passion in the visual arts.
Today, I work as a freelance professional creating visual identities, digital content, and user-centered experiences.
orcamento-desc: UX/UI to optimize video budgets and make life easier for audiovisual professionals.
orcamento-produto-desc: Online platform for video editing and motion design quotes. Users can describe their needs, send references, and receive an automatically estimated value by email.
orcamento-problema-desc: Professionals and clients in the creative field wasted time with manual quotes, lacking clarity on deadlines, scope, and value.
orcamento-objetivo-desc: Create a digital solution that simplifies the quoting process, making it fast, transparent, and easy for both sides.
orcamento-papel-desc: UX/UI Designer responsible for the project from start to finish.
orcamento-resp-desc: Research, requirements definition, wireframes, prototype, UI design, usability testing, accessibility.
orcamento-pesquisa-desc: Participants were selected to represent the profile of potential system users, considering diverse experience in quoting for video and motion design projects. The group brought varied perspectives on the main pains of the traditional process.
orcamento-participantes-desc: 4 remote participants, profile aligned with the target audience
orcamento-participantes-formato-desc: Unmoderated usability study, individual and remote sessions
orcamento-pergunta-1: How often do you need to request quotes for video or motion design projects?
orcamento-pergunta-2: On average, how many minutes do you currently spend to get a video editing quote?
orcamento-pergunta-3: On a scale of 1 to 5, how much clarity do you feel regarding scope and deadline when receiving a traditional/manual quote?
orcamento-pergunta-4: What are the biggest challenges you face when requesting or providing quotes for creative projects?
orcamento-pergunta-5: Describe an experience where there was a lack of clarity in scope, deadline, or value when requesting a quote. What happened?
orcamento-pergunta-6: What information do you consider essential when describing a video project for a quote?
orcamento-pergunta-7: What makes a quote transparent and trustworthy to you?
orcamento-pergunta-8: If you could change something in traditional quoting processes, what would it be?
orcamento-pergunta-9: What would the ideal process be like for requesting and receiving quotes for video/motion projects?
orcamento-pergunta-10: How could an automated digital solution make your day-to-day life easier in this type of work? Do you see any benefits or limitations?
orcamento-dor-clareza-desc: Poorly detailed questions cause confusion and rework.
orcamento-dor-comunicacao-desc: Doubts about styles, deadlines, and visual identity.
orcamento-dor-previsibilidade-desc: Users feel insecure about the final price.
persona-summary: Alice is a 28-year-old freelance editor, serving small businesses and influencers in Brazil and living alone. She values fast and clear quotes to focus on the creative part and balance her personal and professional life. She is frustrated by incomplete briefings, non-transparent negotiation, and an excess of messages.
persona-objetivo-1: Get video and motion project quotes quickly, without bureaucracy.
persona-objetivo-2: Receive clear briefings to avoid rework.
persona-objetivo-3: Have predictability of deadlines and values to plan her schedule and income.
persona-frustracao-1: I waste time exchanging messages just to understand what the client wants.
persona-frustracao-2: Briefings are incomplete, and this causes rework.
jornada-desc: I created a user journey map with Alice's experience using the site to help identify possible pain points and improvement opportunities.
jornada-goal: Facilitate and speed up the receipt and response of video and motion editing budget requests.
jornada-tarefas-1b: Choose the one that seems faster
jornada-sentimento-4a: Confident if visual confirmation is clear
jornada-oportunidades-1b: Explain the benefits of quoting online
jornada-oportunidades-2b: Visual examples and tips to facilitate briefing
jornada-oportunidades-4b: Quick feedback in case of error
prototipo-alta-desc: My high-fidelity prototype followed the same flow as the low-fidelity prototype and incorporated the design changes made after usability testing, as well as several improvements I identified along the way. View the high-fidelity prototype of the Express Editing Budget.
usabilidade-menor-etapa-desc: I reduced the number of steps in the quote request process, making it easier for the user to finish.
usabilidade-avisos-desc: I implemented visual alerts to inform filling errors, confirmations, and guidance, making the process more understandable.
usabilidade-barra-desc: I added a progress bar, instructions, and examples in the fields, organizing information logically and accessibly.
achados-desc: These were the main findings revealed by the usability study:
achado-visualizar-desc: Users wanted to see the progress of filling out the form
achado-perguntas-desc: Some questions were confusing (e.g.: difference between simple/complex editing)
achado-confirmacao-desc: Request for visual confirmation before sending the quote
conclusao-impacto-desc: Faster quoting process, less rework, satisfied users
conclusao-aprendi-desc: Importance of clarity in questions and constant visual feedback
ecommerce-desc: Digital shopping experience, interface design and user journey for an online store.
